column4: Theres like this thing to add to my toolbar on Ubuntu that can change my CPU frequency... Whats the difference if I have it on 1.60 Ghz or 2.13
speed and power draw. more speed more power (and heat)
Have you ever tried the 64 bit version?  Will I still beable to use most of the programs in synaptic?
yes reinstall is the best option
i run 64 bit since intrepid
and everything works fine?
yes
thanks Ill definately switch to that now then to take advantage of my 8 gigs of RAM
could be just that they choose to put the version of the bios in the filename extension
could it sitll be a .bin and I should treat it like that?
yes; but really check carefully the instructions in the manufacturer website. Be very carefull a wrong bios flashing can brick your motherboard

well the guide MSI gave me with the download is ridiculous... Its telling me to execute an exe (flasher) from the A: prompt that wasnt even the same exe as the one they gave me and telling me to use a Bios file that isnt that same number
does it assume Im going to go download a flasher from somewhere else?
you should only use the tools the manufacturer gaves you
then the guide is wrong they gave me
in the msi website ?

i do not know what more to add. is your decision to make... to flash the bios with what you got or not
